item.title: Beogram 4000: Replacing the Reservoir and Motor Capacitors Using a 3D Printed Adapter
item.description:
I’m working on restoring a Beogram 4000 turntable, and one of the challenges is finding modern replacements for the large capacitors used in the 1970s. I received a 3D-printed adapter that allows me to neatly install smaller, current-generation capacitors. item.title: Beogram 4000: Replacement of a Stuck RPM Relay with a Modern Encapsulated SMD Relay
item.description:
During the restoration of a Beogram 4000 turntable, the motor wouldn’t switch to 45 RPM. After changing the control panel lights, it became obvious that the 45 RPM button lit up the correct trimmer pot but the motor speed didn’t change. The issue was a faulty relay that was responsible for switching resistor networks within the Wien oscillator’s feedback loop to adjust the resonance frequency. Finding a replacement relay for vintage electronics can be tricky...
